{"step_by_step_thinking": "Looking at the documents, it is clear that oral contraceptives are associated with several risks. However, the most frequently mentioned and emphasized risk is thromboembolic disorders, particularly in women who smoke or have other risk factors. While there is some association with breast cancer, the documents suggest that the risk is minimal or non-existent in many cases. Hepatic necrosis and permanent sterility are not mentioned as significant risks in the documents.", "answer_choice": "C. Thromboembolic disorders"}
